sen.j: 辰路（たつじ、弘化3年（1846年） - 明治43年（1910年））は、京都嶋原桔梗屋の芸妓である。
sen.e: Tatsuji (1846-1910) is a geisha girl of Shimabara Kikyoya in Kyoto.
Tatsuji (1846-1910) was a geisha of the Shimabara Kikyoya house in Kyoto.
Tatsuji (1846 - 1910) was a geisha of the Shimabara Kikyoya house in Kyoto.
Her real name was Tatsu IZUTSU.
Her real name was Tatsu IZUTSU.
Her real name was Tatsu IZUTSU.
She was also called Tatsuji or Otatsu.
She was also called Tatsuji or Otatsu.
She was also called Tatsuji or Otatsu.

sen.j: 久坂玄瑞となじみ深く、その息子・久坂秀次郎は辰路との間の子であるとも、伏見にいたもう一人の馴染みの女性との子であるともいわれる。
sen.e: She was familiar with Genzui KUSAKA, and his son Shujiro KUSAKA was said to be a child between Genzui and Tatsuji or another woman who was familiar with Genzui in Fushimi.
Tatsuji was intimate with Genzui KUSAKA, and his son, Shujiro KUSAKA, was said to be a child between him and Tatsuji or another woman in Fushimi.
sen.cmt: changed "She" to "Tatsuji" since this is a new paragraph; changed "familiar" to "intimate" for "なじみ深く"; fixed to read more understandably; eliminated unecessary parts
sen.e: Tatsuji was intimate with Genzui KUSAKA, and his son, Shujiro KUSAKA, was said to be a child between him and Tatsuji or another woman in Fushimi.

sen.j: 明治3年（1870年）4月、辰路は下京の裕福な農家の竹岡甚之助と結婚した。
sen.e: On May 1870, she got married with Jinnosuke TAKEOKA who was a rich farmer in Shimogyo district, arranged by the (tenth) lord of Sumiya (a restaurant where high-class harlots and geisha dispatched from a geisha house entertained the guests) and a landlady of Kikyoya in those days.

In May of 1870, Tatsuji was married to Jinnosuke TAKEOKA, who was a rich farmer in the Shimogyo district. The marriage was arranged by the (tenth) lord of Sumiya (a restaurant where high-class harlots and geisha dispatched from a geisha house entertained the guests) and the proprietress of Kikyoya.
sen.cmt: changed "she" to "Tatsuji" since this is a new paragraph; split the sentence into two; fixed grammar to read more undestandably; eliminated "in those days" since it was awkward and unecessary; changed "landlady" to "proprietress" for 女将
sen.e: In May of 1870, Tatsuji was married to Jinnosuke TAKEOKA, who was a rich farmer in the Shimogyo district.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処

sen.j: この結婚は、当時の角屋当主（十代目）と桔梗屋の女将の仲立ちによる。
sen.e: The marriage was arranged by the (tenth) lord of Sumiya (a restaurant where high-class harlots and geisha dispatched from a geisha house entertained the guests) and the proprietress of Kikyoya.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処

sen.j: 明治43年（1910年）、他界。65歳であった。
sen.e: In 1910 she died.
Tatsuji died in 1910 at the age of 65.
sen.cmt: combined with the following sentence to reduce fragmentation and fixed grammar accordingingly
sen.e: Tatsuji died in 1910 at the age of 65.

sen.j: 墓所は京都市西七条の「安阿弥寺」にある。
sen.e: Her grave is placed in 'the Annami-ji Temple' at Nishi-shichijo, Kyoto City.
Her grave was placed in the 'Annami-ji Temple' at Nishi-shichijo, Kyoto City.
sen.cmt: moved quotation mark to not include "the"
sen.e: Her grave was placed in the 'Annami-ji Temple' at Nishi-shichijo, Kyoto City.
